variable.label: Advanced Signal Protocol: Single signal with user defined aspects

factReset.label: HARD RESET all CVs reset to default values

display.label: Select to use settings shown below

label.label: To turn off, use Output Address Mode pane
In Decoder Address Mode, the decoder address is multiplied by four to get the accessory address.
An offset of 1 is required to work with Lenz/Digitrax* systems when compared to Roco/MERG command stations
(*) NB. If using advanced signalling options, then Digitrax does not offset address and follows Roco numbers

display.label: Select to use settings shown below

label.label: To turn off, use Decoder Address Mode pane
In Output Address Mode, the decoder address is the accessory address, there is no multiplication.
An offset of 4 is required to work with Lenz/Digitrax* systems when compared to Roco/MERG command stations
(*) NB. If using advanced signalling options, then Digitrax does not offset address and follows Roco numbers
Toggle Mode is required for some systems, if in doubt, turn on. Duration is (x10 MilliSecs), with 0 = continuous
Use this with Map for Custom Signal Arrangements when using the DCC Advanced Signalling Protocol
Typical uses would be unusual signalling systems, numeric (theatre) displays, etc.
